messages.message:
Standard Chartered has a use case in which they are processing corporate board resolutions in chinese (e.g. "The board hereby agrees to accept $$$ funding in return to ### stock shares to ABC parties..) They want to extract the information in english even though the source document is in Chinese.

Out in SG we showed them how they can do this with a gazetteer (read: simple domain specific dictionary) but they would obviously be interested in more open ended translation.

To be honest, for constrained domains a gazetteer might be the ideal approach even though it is less fancy.. but that's a convo for specific use cases..
